Welcome to Median’s documentation!¶

Median is a simple training module for finding median of row of numbers. Row is combined from two sorted subrows that should be taken from console.

Median’s API is represented by median_of_row.median() which takes two sorted rows of numbers and computes the median of row combined from both taken rows.

Median API:¶

median_of_row.main()¶

Main function that inputs two rows of floats and finds median of joined row.

Returns:Nothing is returned.

main() prints joined row and it’s median in console. For finding median median() is used.

median_of_row.median(row1, row2)¶

Find median for row with elements from both parameters.

Parameters:
  • row1 (list) – First row of values. Must be sorted in some way.
  • row2 (list) – Second row of values. Must be sorted in some way.
Returns:

Median of row of values.

For joining both rows of values merge() is used

median_of_row.merge(list1, list2)¶

Merge procedure from merge sort algorithm.

Parameters:
  • list1 (list) – First list to merge. It should be sorted in some order.
  • list2 (list) – Second list to merge. It should be sorted in the same order as first one.
Returns:

Sorted list of elements both from 1st and 2nd parameters.

Merge procedure is needed for merging two sorted in the same order lists of elements in one sorted list. Sorting order of result list is similar to both parameters’ ones.

median_of_row.row_input(num)¶

Input row of floats from console.

Parameters:num (int) – Number of row that needs to be input.
Returns:List of floats extracted from input string.

List values should be input in one string. row_input() allows multiple spaces. In case of any error while extracting floats from input string error message is shown and row_input() welcomes to try input again. Input is retried until it is successful.
